To secure quick transmission, telegrams should be marked Via Eastern. For latest average time to London, see daily bulletin in this paper. Peninsular and Oriental S. N. Company. Summer Rates will be charged from 2 May to 31 October. For the convenience of families and others,a large portion of each ship’s accommodation has ; been reserved for Egypt, so that Berths can be definitely engaged at once, as if the voyage were commencing at Port Said. Plans can be seen at the Offices of the Company's Agents. The through Steamers for Marseilles and London are intended to leave Port 8aid after the arrival of the 11 a.m. train from Cairo, every Monday until June, and then every Tuesday. A steam tendor will meet tho train to convey passengers to the ship. Caledonia..... 8 May I Arabia ........ 6 June I Eorpr............. 4 July Moldavia........ 15 „ I Himalaya......13 „ Britannia.....11 „ Macedonia....... 22 „ Persia .........20 „ CalkdoniX.....18 „ Victoria ... 29/30 „ | India...........27 „ | Mongolia... ... 25 „ The Brindisi Express Steamers leave Port Said direotly the Indian Mails arrive. Passengers can go on board the evening before. The Faro remains os usual. For all further information apply to the Company’s Agents, Messrs. Thos. Cook & Son (Egypt) Ltd. ............... CAIRO. ON ABONS, KHEDIVIAL MAIL LINE. FAST BRITISH PASSENGER STEAMERS. GREECE - TURKEY ONE. Express steamors leave Alexandria every Wednesday at 4 p.m. for PIR2EUS, SMYRNA, MITYLENE, and CONSTANTINOPLE, in connection with Orient Express train-de-luxe for Vienna, Paris, and London. PALESTINE - SYRIA UNE. Fast steamers leave Alexandria every Saturday at 6 p.m., and Port Said every Sunday at 6 p.m., for JAFFA (for Jerusalem), CAIFFA (for Nazareth), BEYROUT (for Damasous), TRIPOLI, ALEXANDRETTA, MESSINA, continuing in alternate wooks to LARNACA and LIMASSOL (Cyprus). red SEA UNE.

Steamers leave Suez fortnightly on Wednesday at 6 p.m. for JEDDAH, 8UAKIN, MAS80- WAH, HODEIDAH, and ADEN ; and in the intervening weeks for PORT SUDAN and SUARIM direct Calls will be made at TOR (for Mount Sinai) as required.

N.B.—Deck chairs provided for the use of passengers, excellent cuisine and table wine free. Steamer plans may be seen and passages booked at the Company's Agencies at Alexandria, tim Pnrt. Haiti. anrl Rnaz. nr at. Tnns llnnu fir Sam nr ntLnr Tnni-ior Aoi.io.orn Steamer plans

RESIDENTS IN EGYPT proceeding to Europe for the summer are requested to apply to our offices for information respecting their Passages, where steamer plans may be consulted and Berths secured by all Lines of Bteane ra to a 1 parts of the Globe; arrangements can a'so be made for the collection and forwarding of thdir baggage and clearance at port of arrival

CIRCULAR NOTES issued payable at the current rate of exchange in all the principal cities of Europe. Cook's Interpreters in uniform are present at the principal Railway stations and Landing-plaoes in Europe to assist passengers holding their travelling tickets.

Large and splendidly appointed steamers belonging to the Co. leave Cairo thrioe weekly, between November and March, for Luxor, Assouan and Wady-Halfa in oonneotion with trains between November and March, for Luxor, Assouan and Wady-Halfa in oonneotion with trains de luxe to Khartoum. No. 7239] ALEXANDRIA, THURSDAY, JULY 13, 1905. [SIX PAGES P.T. 1.
